title: More breakthroughs, less crossover: Afrobeats is here to stay, on its own terms
description: Something's different about the arrival of the latest African pop stars on the international scene. They are finding success as a wave without compromising or catering to the American music industry.

title: A man died from Alaskapox last month. Here's what we know about the virus
description: The first known fatality was an elderly man who lived alone in a forested area and was immunocompromised. Scientists say there's no evidence of human-to-human transmission of the virus so far.

title: Nintendo amps up an old feud in 'Mario vs. Donkey Kong'
description: The new remake of Mario vs. Donkey Kong delivers ace animation and a welcome "casual mode," but its two-player co-op can be more frustrating than fun.

title: Journalists turn to picket lines as the news business ails
description: Journalists have walked out of two dozen newsrooms over layoffs, budget cuts and fraught contract talks in just the past few weeks. All of them belong to the leading newspaper union, the NewsGuild.

title: The CDC may be reconsidering its COVID isolation guidance
description: The current guidance advises five days of isolation. Unnamed health officials have indicated that this guidance may soon go away, a move that troubles public health experts.

title: Romantic advice (regardless of your relationship status)
description: Valentine's Day is a time to think about love — no matter whether you're single, taken, confused or ready to mingle.

title: How to have 'Perfect Days' in a flawed world — this film embraces beauty all around
description: Shot entirely in Tokyo, this elegant fable is Wim Wenders' best fiction feature in decades. Although it flirts with glibness, Perfect Days asks questions about how to find joy in imperfect situations.

title: Dating habits are changing — again. Here are 3 trends and tips for navigating them
description: Technology, burnout and generational differences are creating new habits in the dating scene. Two dating coaches share advice on how to navigate them.

title: Looking for love? You'll find it in 2024 in these 10 romance novels
description: While many of us are thinking of love this Valentine's Day, here are some of the best romance novels hitting shelves in the first half of the year to help plan your reading tour de romance in 2024.

title: The Oakland As hire the first female primary play-by-play announcer in MLB history
description: Jenny Cavnar will call most of the games during the 2024 season. She was the backup play-by-play announcer for the Colorado Rockies for 12 years and has five Emmys.

title: A dance about gun violence is touring nationally with Alvin Ailey's company
description: Choreographer Jamar Roberts created a piece about gun violence and police brutality when he found himself sleepless over the issue. It's touring now with the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

title: Manny loves Cayenne. Plus, 5 facts about queer animals for Valentine's Day
description:
In a Valentine's Day exclusive report, NPR has learned there is currently a gay anteater couple at Smithsonian's National Zoo and Conservation Biology Institute in Washington D.C.But this couple is just the tip of the proverbial iceberg when it comes to queerness in the animal world – it's been documented in hundreds of species. We spoke with wildlife ecologist Christine Wilkinson of the "Queer is Natural" TikTok series to uncover the wildest, queerest animals of the bunch.

Questions, comments or thoughts on queer animal love? Email us at shortwave@npr.org and we might feature it on a future episode!

title: A radio station is now playing Beyoncé's country song after an outcry from fans
description: A fan said he emailed KYKC in Oklahoma and was told it doesn't play Beyoncé, as it is a country radio station. The station said it did not yet have access to the song.

title: Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas impeached by House Republicans
description: Mayorkas becomes the first cabinet secretary to be impeached since 1876. The Democratic-controlled Senate is expected to leave Mayorkas in office.
